description: The New Orleans Saints might be thinking about reuniting with another former tight end after losing out on Jimmy Graham in free agency. New Orleans hosted Benjamin Watson for a visit on...
title: Saints bring in Benjamin Watson for visit
title_page: Saints bring in Benjamin Watson for visit
maintext:
The New Orleans Saints might be thinking about reuniting with another former tight end after losing out on Jimmy Graham in free agency.
New Orleans hosted Benjamin Watson for a visit on Tuesday, a source confirmed to The Advocate. ESPN’s Field Yates reported the news first.
Watson, 37, turned in a career year for the Saints in 2015, racking up 74 catches, 825 yards and six touchdowns, all career highs, before leaving for Baltimore in the offseason as New Orleans decided to sign Coby Fleener.
The veteran tight end, a locker room leader and a strong voice in the community, tore his Achilles tendon in his first season with Baltimore, but he bounced back with 61 catches, 522 yards and four receptions for the Ravens last year.
New Orleans has been working to address the tight end position in free agency, a spot that Saints coach Sean Payton called a “must” on Tuesday morning at the owner’s meetings.
